options.content:
## How counts are calculated

- We take a daily snapshot of all investors balance per product
- The snapshot has a 2 days delay to give some time to the importer to get all the data
- For each product we compute an [hyperloglog](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HyperLogLog)
- The total investor count has a precision of 15
- Segmented counts has a precision of 13
- We count investor ids, an investor id does not depends on the chain
- If a user has positive balances on multiple products or chains, we count 1

### HyperLogLog precision table

| Precision | Max storage size | 65% CI | 95% CI | 99% CI |
| --------- | ---------------- | ------ | ------ | ------ |
| 10 | 1 KiB + 28 B | ±3.25% | ±6.50% | ±9.75% |
| 11 | 2 KiB + 28 B | ±2.30% | ±4.60% | ±6.89% |
| 12 | 4 KiB + 28 B | ±1.63% | ±3.25% | ±4.88% |
| 13 | 8 KiB + 28 B | ±1.15% | ±2.30% | ±3.45% |
| 14 | 16 KiB + 30 B | ±0.81% | ±1.63% | ±2.44% |
| 15 (default) | 32 KiB + 30 B | ±0.57% | ±1.15% | ±1.72% |
| 16 | 64 KiB + 30 B | ±0.41% | ±0.81% | ±1.22% |
| 17 | 128 KiB + 30 B | ±0.29% | ±0.57% | ±0.86% |

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  datetime AS "time",
  balance
FROM beefy_investor_timeline_cache_ts
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(datetime)
ORDER BY 1

with table_names as (
  select * 
  from (values 
    ('product_stats_investor_counts_with_segments_1d_ts')
  ) as t(table_name)
)
select 
  table_name,
  total_size,
  data_size,
  index_size,
  external_size
from (
(
  select --schemaname as table_schema,
         relname as table_name,
         pg_size_pretty(pg_total_relation_size(relid)) as total_size,
         pg_size_pretty(pg_relation_size(relid)) as data_size,
         pg_size_pretty(pg_indexes_size(relid)) as index_size,
         pg_size_pretty(pg_total_relation_size(relid) - pg_relation_size(relid)) as external_size,
         pg_total_relation_size(relid) as raw_total_relation_size
  from pg_catalog.pg_statio_user_tables
  where schemaname not in ('_timescaledb_config', '_timescaledb_internal', '_timescaledb_catalog', '_timescaledb_cache')
  and relname not like '%_ts'
  and relname in (select table_name from table_names)
  order by pg_total_relation_size(relid) desc,
           pg_relation_size(relid) desc
)
UNION ALL
(
  with timescale_objects as (
      select
          'hypertable' as object_type,
          hypertable_schema || '.' || hypertable_name as table_display_name,
          hypertable_schema || '.' || hypertable_name as table_internal_name
      from timescaledb_information.hypertables
      where hypertable_name in (select table_name from table_names)
      UNION ALL
      select
          'continuous aggregate' as object_type,
          view_schema || '.' || view_name as table_display_name,
          materialization_hypertable_schema || '.' || materialization_hypertable_name as table_internal_name
      from timescaledb_information.continuous_aggregates
      where view_name in (select table_name from table_names)
  )
  select --ht.object_type, 
      ht.table_display_name, 
      --ht.table_internal_name,
      pg_size_pretty(htds.total_bytes) as total_bytes,
      pg_size_pretty(htds.table_bytes) as table_size,
      pg_size_pretty(htds.index_bytes) as index_bytes,
      pg_size_pretty(htds.toast_bytes) as toast_bytes,
      htds.total_bytes as raw_total_bytes
  from timescale_objects as ht,
  lateral (
      select
          sum(table_bytes) as table_bytes,
          sum(index_bytes) as index_bytes,
          sum(toast_bytes) as toast_bytes,
          sum(total_bytes) as total_bytes
      from hypertable_detailed_size(ht.table_internal_name)
  ) as htds
  order by htds.total_bytes desc
)
) as t
order by raw_total_relation_size desc

with chain_stats_ts as (
SELECT
    time_bucket('4h', s.datetime) AS "datetime",
    p.chain,
    distinct_count(rollup(s.approx_count_investor_hll_all)) as approx_investor_count
  FROM product_stats_investor_counts_with_segments_1d_ts s
  join product p using (product_id)
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(datetime)
    and product_id in ($_product_ids)
  group by
    1,2
  order by 1
)
select 
    time_bucket('$interval', datetime) AS "time",
    chain,
    last(approx_investor_count, datetime) as approx_investor_count
from chain_stats_ts
group by 1,2
order by 1

SELECT
    time_bucket('4h', s.datetime) AS "time",
    distinct_count(rollup(s.approx_count_investor_hll_all)) as approx_investor_count
  FROM product_stats_investor_counts_with_segments_1d_ts s
  join product p using (product_id)
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(datetime)
    and product_id in ($_product_ids)
  group by
    1
  order by 1

with product_stats_ts_recent as (
  SELECT
      s.product_id,
      last(s.datetime, s.datetime) AS "datetime",
      last(distinct_count(s.approx_count_investor_hll_all), s.datetime) as approx_investor_count
    FROM product_stats_investor_counts_with_segments_1d_ts s
    WHERE
      datetime < '${__to:date:iso}'
      and product_id in ($_product_ids)
    group by 1
),
product_stats_ts_compare_to as (
  SELECT
      s.product_id,
      last(s.datetime, s.datetime) AS "datetime",
      last(distinct_count(s.approx_count_investor_hll_all), s.datetime) as approx_investor_count
    FROM product_stats_investor_counts_with_segments_1d_ts s
    WHERE
      datetime < '${__from:date:iso}'
      and product_id in ($_product_ids)
    group by 1
),
product_stats_ts_compared as (
  select recent.product_id,
    compare_to.datetime as compare_to_datetime,
    recent.datetime as recent_datetime,
    recent.datetime - compare_to.datetime as datetime_diff,
    compare_to.approx_investor_count as compare_to_approx_investor_count,
    recent.approx_investor_count as recent_approx_investor_count,
    recent.approx_investor_count - compare_to.approx_investor_count as approx_investor_count_diff,
    (recent.approx_investor_count - compare_to.approx_investor_count)::double precision / compare_to.approx_investor_count::double precision as approx_investor_count_diff_percent
  from product_stats_ts_recent recent
  left join product_stats_ts_compare_to compare_to using (product_id)
)
select p.product_key,
  coalesce(p.product_data->'vault'->>'id', p.product_data->'boost'->>'id') as beefy_id,
  ts.*
from product_stats_ts_compared ts
join product p using (product_id)
order by ts.approx_investor_count_diff desc

SELECT
   s.datetime AS "time",   
   distinct_count(rollup(approx_count_investor_hll_0_10) filter (where approx_count_investor_hll_0_10 is not null)) as "approx_count_investor [$0->$10)",
   distinct_count(rollup(approx_count_investor_hll_10_100) filter (where approx_count_investor_hll_10_100 is not null)) as "approx_count_investor [$10->$100)",
   distinct_count(rollup(approx_count_investor_hll_100_1000) filter (where approx_count_investor_hll_100_1000 is not null)) as "approx_count_investor [$100->$1,000)",
   distinct_count(rollup(approx_count_investor_hll_1000_10000) filter (where approx_count_investor_hll_1000_10000 is not null)) as "approx_count_investor [$1,000->$10,000)",
   distinct_count(rollup(approx_count_investor_hll_10000_100000) filter (where approx_count_investor_hll_10000_100000 is not null)) as "approx_count_investor [$10,000->$100,000)",
   distinct_count(rollup(approx_count_investor_hll_100000_1000000) filter (where approx_count_investor_hll_100000_1000000 is not null)) as "approx_count_investor [$100,000->inf)"
FROM product_stats_investor_counts_with_segments_1d_ts s
join product p using (product_id)
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(datetime)
  and product_id in ($_product_ids)
group by
  1
order by 1

list.definition: select distinct chain from product where chain not in ('harmony', 'heco')
list.name: chain
list.query: select distinct chain from product where chain not in ('harmony', 'heco')

list.definition:
select chain || ':' || case when product_data->'vault' is not null then 'vault' else 'boost' end || ':' || coalesce(product_data->'vault'->>'id', product_data->'boost'->>'id') || ' ' || product_key
from product 
where chain in ($chain)
 and  CASE 
         WHEN '$include_eol' = 'yes' THEN true
         ELSE coalesce(product_data->'boost', product_data->'vault')->>'eol' = 'false'
    END
list.name: product_keys
list.query:
select chain || ':' || case when product_data->'vault' is not null then 'vault' else 'boost' end || ':' || coalesce(product_data->'vault'->>'id', product_data->'boost'->>'id') || ' ' || product_key
from product 
where chain in ($chain)
 and  CASE 
         WHEN '$include_eol' = 'yes' THEN true
         ELSE coalesce(product_data->'boost', product_data->'vault')->>'eol' = 'false'
    END

list.definition:
select product_id 
from product 
where product_key in ($product_keys)
list.name: _product_ids
list.query:
select product_id 
from product 
where product_key in ($product_keys)
